annotation.TEXT: Aw, man... No fireworks this time...
Also, this multi-coin block seems to be lasting for a long time...
D'oh! Wasn't expecting another flame suddenly there! Oh, well. Now I can show you what happens if you grab the axe while Bowser's still alive.
If you're big here, your head will somehow catch on the pipe entrance and allow you inside. I wonder what would happen if you were small, though...
Hey, these koopas have no wings, so how are they floating?
And that's game!
Yeah, that sucked!
Oh, hey. I don't remember those guys being there before. Yeah, Hard mode also comes with extra enemies that you won't see the first time around.
You know what? Nuts to this level! I'm outta here!
Also, the star may only last one second, but it's still useful for getting rid of the first plant over here, since it's in a bad location to try to fry.
Ooh, there's another parakoopa. Since it's just walking, I should be able to...
Alright, now to get my firepower back!
Well, that didn't work out too well, and now I'm stuck. However, at least in this case, it was kind of my fault, and I could let atai run out to restart the level.

Now, if you're super and you duck jump into the upper-right here, you can hit all of the ⑨ blocks and escape. But it's tricky, and if you get hit, you'll be trapped, so you might just want to jump over this whole part.
Well, I don't think I'm totally stuck. Let me fiddle around for a bit...
I believe that red parakoopa was new. However, it walked off the edge despite being red. How odd...
Watch out for this Bullet Bill. It should be very easy to stomp though.
Yay for coins!
Die, goomba!
Boing! ...Umm... I said, "Boing!" Oh, come on. Boing, already!
And jumping on them apparently gives them wings (like Red Bull), but then they walk around on the ground.
This is Maruq's spell card. If you collect a flower, you can shoot fireballs into the air in an arc, and you keep this power until you take a hit or lose a life.
There we go! Now, it's time for the final battle against Bowser himself! If you have fireballs, stand back and attack from a distance. Don't worry about his hammers, as they're going the wrong way.
Oh, man. Running low on atai again? I've been dawdling too much. Now, be careful here, as you could end up trapped if you're not careful!
Nuts to you, springboard!
But our Cirno is in another castle! Just kidding!
Umm... Can I even get into the the entry pipe while small here?
Of course, I don't have my power ups anymore, so I'm going to have to time these jumps carefully...
Hello! This is SomeGuy712x, and welcome to ⑨!
Well, that wasn't much of a demo. Alright, let's start the game!
And, as you just saw, grabbing the axe causes only a small portion of the bridge to disappear, but Bowser will fall regardless of where he is.
Well, it's nice to know that the "sliding on one foot" trick still works!
Ooh, boy. My atai's running out. I'd better hurry!
Alright, I just completed world 9-9, so now it's time for world 9-0!
Ow, that sucks, but I can easily repower up right here.
It's great for enemies above you, but you can't hit something that's right in front of you with it.

Alright, star power, activate! ...Wait, what? Yeah, the star is just as defective as the springboard. You only get maybe a second of actual invincibility. Also, watch out, as these stupid plants don't care whether you're on their pipes, and will pop up anyway.
Nope, it looks like the same world 9 as before. Well, let's play through it again, now that we're on the Hard difficulty.
Watch out for the flames here. I am aware of a few invisible coin blocks here, which I'll reveal.
I don't know if there are any more hidden blocks though. If there are indeed more, let me know!
Well, that's it for Hard mode! I hope you all enjoyed watching me play through ⑨! This is SomeGuy712x, signing off. Have a good day!
Oh, yeah. Bowser backs away from you if you get on his right, and then he faces left (causing half of him to vanish) and starts breathing fire that appears from the right, so watch out for that.
Let's back up and try this again, but finish the first level while big this time!
How long does this multi-coin block last?
...Wait a minute... What?
Unfortunately, even though we're on Hard mode now, our spell card is still stuck on Easy, so it still can't hit things directly in front of us.
Yes! Now, for whatever reason, the next two pipes don't have plants in them, which is good.
Okay, let's not try to take any bogus shortcuts this time. Instead, let's see if I can nail that podoboo with the star's brief invincibility...
Since it's Cirno Day, I've decided to play this Super Mario Bros. hack.
Honestly, I'm not big on the idea of how this part works. Even for a hack like this, you shouldn't be forced to finish a level big in order to avoid getting hopelessly trapped.
This is kind of shaped like a castle entrance, but we're actually underground. Also, it's apparently cloudy down here.
Just like SMB's hard mode, the terrain is the same, but the basic enemies move faster, and goombas change into buzzies.
Doesn't look like it, which means I'm totally stuck. Darn it!
Gaah!!! Why am I acting like a baka all of a sudden?
Whoops! Got hasty there. Both of those ⑨ blocks have power ups, but only one can be on the screen at a time, so if you want both, don't reveal the second until you collect the first.
There's the ending flagpole. What's that symbol on the flag mean? Does anyone know? (According to chrideedee, that symbol is "chi" in katakana.)
Let's try that again!
Ooh, I even got a firework! Nice!
I'm the strongest!
The goomba didn't die when I flattened it?!
In this game, you control Maruq, who is almost exactly like Mario, so if you know how to control Mario, this should be no problem.
Oh, come on. How did I miss the midair kick there?
Hmm... That was odd. That parakoopa was just walking along the ground, and "shelled up" after I stomped it once.
There's more power ups in these two ⑨ blocks, in case you need them. And make sure you do get fully powered up here. You'll need to be soon.
Alright, that's enough of that. I'm taking off. Stay on the ground here to easily avoid the firebar.
And there's a buzzy in a 9! I think it might be possible to glitch yourself in there, but that probably wouldn't be a good idea.
Yeah, I think this springboard is defective. Sorry, folks. It looks like I may be stuck here.
Fire Sign "Fireball Fall" (Easy)
Yes, I'm big now! Also, you get nine points for practically everything, and your score, coins, world, and atai are only made up of nines and zeroes.
At this point, you can press B to go back to the title screen. Hmm... Can you use B to select a different world?
Yeah, got it! However, even if you manage to kill a podoboo (with a star or kicked shell), another one will take its place, so you can't permanently get rid of a podoboo.
Okay, I'm just going to let this goomba walk into the pit here...
Yes! Take that, springboard! If you press A on the exact right frame at the end of the springboard's bouncing animation, you'll do a normal jump instead. (This also works in the original SMB.)

I don't know what the deal is with the repeating and seemingly cutoff text here. Also, what's that bottom line say? And why does Cirno have a parakoopa with her? (According to Gameboygenius, the bottom line says "Atai" in hiragana.)
Yes! It said only "9" there, but my score actually jumped by 90,000! Okay, now let's hit some more ⑨ blocks.

Oh, yeah. The multi-coin block is unlimited here. Okay, let's move on. There's many more firebars this time, but stay on the floor anyway. It's still the safest place, and if you're small or ducking on the floor, you can't be hit at all.
Yes, I got 9!
Squish! Ooh, coins!
Uh, oh. There's a Hammer Bro! But, he's tossing his hammers backwards for some reason. He's still dangerous to try to stomp, though, so frying him from behind the pipe is a good idea.
Demo count: 9
Well, I see a 9 up there... Is it a different 9?
Watch out for the piranha plants and the podoboo here. Try to fry the plants from a distance if you can.
Ooh, extra life! I must've gotten over 99 total coins!
Okay, let's let the title demo play out first...
Or, I can go straight to the second pipe with it. That works too. Now to carefully get past this part...
Alright, I got three fireworks this time!
